headline: Super Easy Chicken and Dumplings
description: This recipe for easy chicken and dumplings could not be more simple and it tastes great too. With just a few ingredients, you can enjoy this classic.

video.name: How To Make Super Easy Chicken And Dumplings

name: Super Easy Chicken and Dumplings
recipeIngredient: 2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Stir condensed soup, chicken broth, and shredded chicken together in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until it begins to simmer.
Cut each biscuit into quarters, and gently stir into the simmering soup.
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until biscuits are no longer doughy in the center, 10 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I’m making now, liked the other comments about adding more spices and have added carrots and celery which I softened before, oregano, garlic, rosemary and a spoon of chicken bullion plus several large pats of butter. Very good. Lots of chicken and rolled out the Grands and cut into 1/8 which cooks better. Tastes good.
It is absolutely delicious and so easy to cook I recommend to use this recipe if you are cooking chicken dumplings
I've made it twice now, and we love it. Very quick and easy to make and the leftovers make a great lunch, reheated the next day.
I switched 1 can of cream of chicken to 1 can of cream of mushroom. added i stick of butter.
My husband loves to eat this for dinner!
When I don't have time to make dumplings I use the canned biscuit method. I do press parsley in each quarter then salt and pepper to taste. AWESOME!!!!
Super easy and a big hit with my family. Great for a last minute dinner.
Recipes like this quick and easy with a busy work schedule....
Decent when ur short on time.
So quick and easy to make and delicious just as it is! Definitely will make again
Perfect

I have made this several times for people who have just returned home from the hospital and their digestive tracks aren't quite back to normal yet. Even though they might not have an appetite, they welcome this. It's easy for them to eat and they love the flavor. Paired with a jello salad, it is just what the doctor ordered!
i tweeked it a bit. Added 3 cloves of fresh garlic, celery, and onion finely chopped. Also add Italian seasoning, parsley for color, onion and garlic powder. And 2 chicken bullion cubes
No changes

I made this for dinner and everyone loves it I only added salt and pepper I did not add the 2 cans of biscuits because if I had it would have soaked up all the juices it was a really easy recipe and was good and filling I recommend only using 1 can of biscuits but that's just my opinion
Yes I put carrots celery half of green pepper onions and a small garlic, so easy

Excellent for a cold rainy night. I used only one can of biscuits because we like a lot of broth. So quick and easy when you don’t have time to cook a whole chicken. We will definitely make this again!
This recipe is a comfort food for me. I grew up eating chicken an dumplings but made from scratch, this is a great shortcut will definitely make again
Super eaz y taste great i left out cream kf cbjckdn siup
Awesome and very easy!!

I've always made chicken and dumplings from scratch as my momma taught me. I was in a time crunch one day so I tried this recipe. I guess it's a decent recipe for an inexperienced cook, but the juice was too creamy/thick, and even tho I rolled out the biscuits, the dumplings were still just doughballs and tasted like slimy canned biscuits. My family was very disappointed and I learned my lesson...

It says large saucepan. I used the 5qt and it just was not big enough. The liquid spilled all over my stove and made a huge mess. I had to split it into 2 pans and it was extremely runny. Would have preferred a much thicker type. It was basically soup with biscuits.
It’s amazing! Had to Cook the biscuits a little bit longer due to the pot I was using but 100000000000/10 new favorite recipe.
It was good fast and coming from someone who doesn't like boiled chicken (I used rotisserie chicken when I made it) this was so much better then the original from scrap recipe.
Delicious!
I boiled 5 chicken breasts to make the broth. I also used 20 Great Value frozen biscuits.
I only used one can of cream of chicken, I love chicken and dumplings so this was a quick recipe to whip up the kids. And oh, I served corn on the cob with it ?? thanks alot.
Coming from a newly married woman who has never cooked anything ever.... this was easy and tasted amazing. I followed directions precisely and me n the hubby was very pleased.
Good and easy. I add peas and carrots. Have also used noodles or wild rice in place of the dumplings.

This is a great basic recipe that you can tweak however you like. I started by dicing an onion and sauteing it in olive oil until softened. Then I added in the broth, soup and chicken. I added some frozen mixed veggies and yukon gold potatoes cut in 1 inch cubes. I seasoned it all with about 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp dried parsley, 1/2 tsp dried thyme.
Very good, basic recipe. It was a little bland for my palate, so I added some other spices to it this time.
Turned out great tasting!!

I have been craving my grandmas southern chicken and dumplings for over a year. I’ve always been intimidated by the process of it. Then I found this recipe... and I am so so so happy! It was exactly what I needed! Super easy and super good!!!! It’s a must try.

Super yum! 5 stars because it truly was easy. I halved the recipe because I only had 1 can of cream of chicken and it turned out great. I did add the full amount of chicken stock though since my biscuits were the grands version. I also added carrots, bunch of seasonings (pepper, dried parsley, minced onion, oregano, and a dash of chili flakes), as well as sauteing the chicken in bacon fat (since I had it left from breakfast that AM). I also cut the chicken into cubes before sauteing and just added everything to the pan after. I suggest using a Dutch oven or larger pot if you go the extra liquid route.
So yummy!
So delicious. One tip, quarter and cook the biscuits, then insert into soup and chicken mix.
just added a bag of frozen peas and carrots, but everything else, the same
This was my first tome making homemade chicken and dumplings. It was a hit for everyone. Not a single bit was leftover. Definitely recommend.

This recipe tastes amazing. I did tweet the recipe just a bit and added about another cup and half of chicken broth but that was because I had to feed more people so I added the broth and about a 1 1/2 tsp of corn starch because I like mine a bit thicker. Then I added a can of mixed vegetables. I think the best part about this recipe is that my EXTREMELY picky stepdaughter, loves it. Finally! Thank you for sharing this great recipe!! ?? From Belton TX.

My husband has been wanting me to make chicken and dumplings for a while now, so I finally decided to give it a go. Well! It went down a treat! I'll probably use more broth to the biscuits next time, and although I have to make a roux to replace the soup (we're lactose intolerant), it doesn't add too much to the time to make. Hint: you might to cut the biscuit dough into eights to get a better-cooked biscuit before too much soup is soaked up.
I made it came out great, used pillsbury original canned biscuits. I boiled leg quarters. Came out so good. Added pepper, onion and garlic powder.
I added some cut up celery and frozen carrots to the recipe and my kiddos LOVED it! Didn't make any other changes other than add the veggies. Will be making several times again!
Diced the chicken instead of shredding. Added onion, carrot, celery and garlic. Sprinkled salt, pepper and parsley on the top.
Super easy, just like the title says!! :) Came out delicious!
Super easy every one loved it was a bit of biscuits but ill tweak next time to my preference!
Fabulous and very easy.

Family loved it, especially my husband who doesn’t always say when he likes something. He said this needs to be on a regular rotation. I added celery, carrots and half an onion as well as a few dashes of white onion. Will make again and again.

Ive been making this for years in my slow cooker
I cut up the grands in a cross to make 4 each biscuit so the dumplings dont get too big. Also you can roll them lightly to tighten them of you prefer a tighter dumping.

Made it last night. Forgot to take picture. It is absolutely delicious just as is it and so quick and simple to make. Maybe took 20 minutes total time. I know I will be making this again and again. I cut the biscuits into smaller pieces. That’s the only thing different I did.
This is the stove top version of our favorite slow cooker recipe. I add Vidalia onion to the chicken while it cooks as well. It's Sooooo Goooood!!!!!
easy and good-i always add butter and English Peas (Frozen} to it --LOVE it!

I've been wanting some chicken and dumplings but didn't want to make the dumplings from scratch. I just don't have time for that. This was so easy and delicious! I made it exactly the way the recipe is except doubled up so we could have leftovers!
Nope my wife likes food plain no veggies me on the other hand I love it all
I boiled the chicken first than shredded and put it soo in the crock pot with the biscuits but it was very thick but delicious
Fresh herbs and spices added for preference, otherwise it is perfect the way it is!
It turned out really good. The whole family ate it right up. My normal chicken and dumplings I always have left overs. None this time!!

I made the dumpling portion of the recipe using homemade stock, chicken, carrots, onion, and celery. I had 'butter tasting' frozen biscuits on hand and they worked great! I did thaw them then rolled them out to about 1/8" with plenty of flour before cutting them into ribbons with a pizza cutter. They were done in about 12 minutes. Turned out great!

I would definitely make it again, I added carrots, celery and frozen peas and used chicken thighs instead of breast because it's what I had on hand. The biscuit dumplings just would not cook up correctly, they were awful, but the soup was really good. Next time it's just the soup and probably back to bisquick dumplings.
Easy to make and taste great with the biscuits I used the frozen pilsbury biscuit and let them thraw out wonderful

Really good! Super easy, especially when I only picked the stuff up on my way home from work and didn't want to stand around cooking.
I did tweak it a bit. I did season it all with salt, pepper, celery salt, and a tiny bit of thyme as I was cooking. I used 1 can of lower sodium cream of chicken soup and 1 can of cream of celery. I used 1 can of lower sodium chicken broth and almost 1 whole can of vegetable broth (I eyed it). I wanted it to be more thick than soupy. I only used 1 can of biscuits, which was a 16 oz can, and cut each biscuit into 6-8 pieces. We loved it. My fiance is a picky eater and he ate his whole bowl. I can't sneak veggies in with him, so having the veggie broth and cream of celery gave us the flavors without him ignoring the food. Will definitely make this again and again.
If your a picky eater this is great and tastes delicious.
It is great easy and my family loves it. Thank you.
Not foreign to the kitchen, but I'm definitely no Paula Deen. This was super easy to follow and came out good
My family adds celery, chopped boiled eggs, and a good amount of black pepper.
This is so easy and so delicious. My family loved it. Definitely will continue to make!
Quick, easy, delicious! What more could you ask for? Perfect!!!
I added black pepper, but this recipe is so good and easy!
i use both cubs instead

I use 1 can of cream of chicken and 1 can of Campbell’s canned chicken and dumplings. I let my shredded chicken simmer in swans chicken broth seasoned with a few spices then mix it together in a pot until boiling reduce the heat and add frozen dumpling strips it comes out delicious.

I had never attempted this dish before and changed quite a few things but it still turned out amazing and even the picky two year old loved it! I used bouillon cubes instead of broth, added a can of carrots, and allowed frozen yeast rolls to rise before tearing them up.
This is a great simple recipe. Spices can be added to suit anyone's taste's. I have not always succeeded when making this dish. But this was a keeper. They were surprised at how good.
Awesome and si easy love love it!!!!

I always tweek recipes, this one was a good guide. Here's mine, altered to more my Southern taste:

- Rotisserie chicken, deboned
-Only 1 Can Cream of Chicken(or Cream of Mushroom is good too)
-1 box (about 4cups) Chicken STOCK (not broth!!)
-1 Can of biscuits, open, flatten them, and cut up. (I also like whipping up Bisquik drop biscuits and just dropping them by the spoonful into the simmering broth.)

I get a deep pot WITH a lid. I bring the chicken and the broth to a good simmer, add frozen veggies if I want, then drop the biscuits in. Stir gently, add more biscuits, and repeat til all biscuits are dropped. When done, reduce the heat. Keep the lid on the whole time. Sea salt, pepper, and add a little teaspoon of butter if desired (I do.). You can add onion powder, garlic powder, whatever, if your heart desires.
 Voila! Dinner is served after about 30 minutes. Stripping the chicken takes the most time.
Tip: Keep any biscuit stuff cold!! Also, Bisquick does best when you let it rest for a minute, after whipping it up.
It was delicious!!!! It’s gone or I would have posted it!
This was a very tasty and quick meal after grocery shopping and me picking up a rotisserie chicken . I added two cups of water and used two 12oz cans of biscuits. I will make again.
I’ve made this multiple times and have loved it! Wonder what it would taste like if I swapped one of the cream of chickens for either cream of onion or cream of mushrooms???

i made this tonight it was the bomb. The only thing I did was instead of using salt and pepper I used 21 Salute from Trader Joe's when I was cooking my chicken breast and used the broth they were cooking in. I had to double mine for guests and they loved it. This my first attempt at making dumplings. I will make this again.

I used low sodium broth & cream of chicken because I didn’t want the salt to overpower my spices. I used Old Bay & Goya, garlic powder, diced celery, dried basil, thyme, diced bell peppers & yellow onion. The aroma lit up my entire home. Soooo good!

Very good dorm/apartment meal. If your biscuit are jumbo like mine, cut them smaller than quarters, also squish them together a bit because some of the layers of buiscut flaked off into just a flat layer of dough.
Super easy! Doesn't take long to make! Cheap! Sooo delicious!
Turned out great!!! So yummy.
This is the best chicken and dumplings I've ever made. I didn't have any cream of chicken soup I just used a little corn starch slurry and it turned out perfect. Definitely a keeper!!!

It was delicious, especially the leftovers the day after. I did not have any maple syrup so I used caramel instead. I spread the cream cheese on the bread and then spread caramel dipping ontop of the bread cubes.
We add veggies to ours like carrots, celery, green peppers. The biscuit dough turns out great.
It turned out great! However, it could use a little seasoning of some sort

So easy and delicious. I thought about the option of using biscuits in the can, but I wanted to experiment. I followed the homemade dumpling recipe and it turned out perfect. The taste of this recipe reminded me of my grandmother's chicken and dumpling recipe minus that fried and crumbled bacon that she added. She was a Southern woman and added bacon to almost everything. Will definitely use the bacon the next time I make this.

I make this all the time. The only thing I do differently is instead of refrigerated biscuits, I use bisquick. The biscuits were just a tad bit sweet for our taste. My family absolutely loves this meal. Especially my daughter who is the pickiest eater ever. Thank you so very much.
My family loves this, but I kick it up a little with some canned sliced carrots, rosemary, garlic salt, and fresh ground black pepper.

My family loves chicken and dumplings! I added carrots and celery, also onion powder and turmeric! I always add turmeric to soups for the health value. This turned out great! I love making it in the slow cooker as well but you have to put the dumplings in 1 hour before you eat!
Love the ease of it. DD can't get enough. I add celery and it boosts the flavor and adds a little texture.
I made added frozen veggies to make it more rounded, but it was a hit with the kids.

It'd be ok if it'd said to put it in a stock pot so it didn't overflow. Not sure how it would've originally tasted since i lost all my juice to the dumplings and overflowing. I had to put another can of cream of chicken and more broth. I think I'm done torturing my family by trying to cook. Salisbury Steak and frozen lasagna, here i come. I've missed you!

I had everything on hand including a rostistary chicken. It was super easy and tasty. Not the old fashion southern recipe I grew up on, but it also only took 15 minutes to prepare and my family loved it. I only modified it by adding a can of cream of celery soup, garlic and some pepper. And I flattened my biscuits using some flour. It helped with making it thicker as it cooked. One of my son's just had his wisdom teeth out and he gobbled it up. Thanks for the easy and sussesful version!

Here are changes that I made that I think make a huge difference.
1. Most important: Don't cut the biscuits into quarters. This method creates dumplings that are too thick and doughy. Instead, on a well-floured surface roll the biscuits to 1/8th inch thickness (or until the flattened biscuit is about the size of your hand) and then cut into strips. I use a pizza cutter for this part. Boil the strips for about 15 minutes.
 2. Add the chicken carcass into the broth while you're prepping your other ingredients, then strain the broth before you add in the dumplings. Lower effort alternatives: add in a couple of bullion cubes and/or use a microplane to grate in a clove of garlic - just one! You want a little flavor, but you're not making garlic dumplings. I also like to pulverize a few teaspoons of poultry seasoning in a mortar/pestle and add that to the broth. Throw in a few sprigs of fresh thyme or rosemary if they're handy. Just throw in the whole sprig and then fish it out before you cook the dumplings.
3. I prefer to use evaporated milk over the cream of chicken soup. It gives me more control over the final salt levels. You'll need about half a 13oz can + a bit more for #4.
4. Reserve some of the evaporated milk and use it to make a cornstarch slurry. Slowly add until broth reaches desired thickness.

It's still a really low effort recipe even with these changes. Rolling out the biscuits adds the most work, but it's so worth it.

This is pretty good but it did need some onion, salt/pepper, and celery to make it less bland. When I made it again, I used one can of cream of celery soup instead of one of the cream of chicken because my husband isn't a huge fan of celery. I also added onion. I boiled boneless, skinless chicken breasts in the broth, when the chicken was done, I shredded it, added it back to the broth, added the soups, onion, and biscuits. I did find that the biscuits are way too big if you use Grands biscuits and if you don't cut them really small.

I love this I make often but boiled chicken breast in 2 cream of chicken and 1 cream of mushroom 3 cups chicken broth add can of veg all and add potatoes and seasoning it and also sprinkle parsley on biscuits before I put in to boil turns out awesome everything.
This is easy to make, and it taste great. Adding celery and onions at flavor. This is a keeper. J2
Loved it! Used frozen veggies, and it still came out great.

So easy and my kids loved it! I keep rotisserie chicken in the freezer so that makes it even faster. I used a little less broth than the recipe called for but mostly because my pan wouldn't hold it all. I added some seasoning as it was otherwise a little bland for our taste. Some dried time, a little shake of garlic salt and about 1/2 tsp of regular salt and that livened it up a lot. If you have chicken in the freezer, this is an easy week-night supper.
